text: well I didn't
know who I was going to be and I was
actually I guess I was questioning that
even in my early early years because I
sort of was in a chaotic family and
um I sort of knew that I
could sing and dance you know around the
grandparents and all that sort of thing
but I was taken to the theater by my
mother a children's theater called the
curtain poers in Cleveland Ohio and
um I watched the
show and I
said I want to do
that and that was it I mean it's never
ever changed I knew what it was I was
going to do
at that
moment um how I can't I don't know how
to explain that
but it sort of gave me a purpose and a
place
uh to put all of
my particular
chaos uh into something very productive
and I loved it and I learned so much I
think I learned learn more about the
theater and about my
craft in
those 3 years between 9 and
12 uh than I ever did again and I
studied with um sford
Meisner uh at the neighborhood Playhouse
and wi hanman and uh I've I've worked
with some great people and learned a lot
but I think that what I learned between
9 and
12 um
has had a tremendous impact on who it is
I am as an
actor my very first experience uh in
this play on borrow time that I did when
I was
nine and
I I I had a death
scene and I
actually was on the stage and I heard
people sobbing in the
audience I thought wow
wow this is the real
thing this is what the theater is about
and the fact that I can be a part of
that because very
often when
people have an experience in the theater
they've already learned some life
lessons so there's
something that you kind of feel
is maybe important even if it's to one
person um then I was on stage with my
father who was a great yetish comedian
and I was 16 years
old
and I didn't know how to sing or dance
but I wanted to be on the stage so he
gave me a part in his variety show and I
came out and I'm singing this song and
the audience is
hysterical and I it wasn't funny
song so um finally somebody at the in
the front row I think
went and I went
oops and then I don't know what made me
do it and it wasn't just smart I said I
never got such a big hand on my
opening and that's at
16 um
a very strange thing that happened I was
I was working out in Summer Stock and
um at the end of the show I I was taking
a bow and you know sometimes people
reach up to you and there was this young
man who who reached up to me and I as I
looked at him I saw in his eyes there
was something wrong and he in fact
pulled me off the stage into the
pit and uh luckily I didn't get hurt
but th those are some of the chances you
take and of course uh I've been injured
on the stage and injured in movies and I
can you know dancing is it just takes
every muscle especially if you're not a
dancer a natural dancer I'm I'm
essentially an actor and the fact that I
got away with singing and dancing for a
long time is still a miracle to me
